area_name: Mather Gorge Maryland - Greek Wall Area

content.description: Start: Approximately 10 feet left of the crack
content.location: Approximately 10 feet left of the crack

content.description: Start: Approximately 15 feet left of the crack.   Climb up left and then straight up.
content.location: Approximately 15 feet left of the crack

content.description: Start five right of Dorain crack. Claimb through the bulge and stay on the upper face between the arete and the Dorian crack.
content.location: Five feet right of Dorian Crack

content.description: Start: Approximately 5 feet left of the crack.
content.location: Approximately 5 feet left of the crack.

content.description: Start: At the crack at the right hand side of the wall.   Follow the crack.
content.location: At the crack at the right hand side of the wall.

pathTokens: Mather Gorge Maryland - Greek Wall Area

content.description: Approximately 1 mile from either the visitors center or the Old Anglers Inn parking area and directly across from the Degree 101 buttress is a small smooth vertical wall with its left hand side hidden by a low angle buttress.  The best approach for getting to this area is to follow the tow path to the trail head, 100 yards downstream from the lock at the upper end of Widewater.  Take this trail west to the river.  The descent for these climbs is by 4th class gully at the upstream end of the face.
